title: Thomas Usherwood
text:
Thomas Edward Usherwood (Christmas Eve 1841 - 9 February 1939) was <a href="Archdeacon">Archdeacon</a> of <a href="Pietermaritzburg">Maritzburg</a> from 1878 to 1887.
Fogg was educated at <a href="Queens%27%20College%2C%20Cambridge">Queens' College, Cambridge</a> After <a href="Curate">Curacies</a> in <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a>, <a href="Uffington%2C%20Shropshire">Uffington</a> and <a href="High%20Ercall">High Ercall</a> he went out to <a href="South%20Africa">South Africa</a> in 1874. On his return to <a href="England">England</a> in 1902 he held <a href="Incumbent%20%28ecclesiastical%29">incumbencies</a> at <a href="Chaldon%20Herring">Chaldon Herring</a> then <a href="Coombe%20Keynes">Coombe Keynes</a>.
